poem:
Title: "Dawn of Decision"

Elections ripe with ballyhoo,
On January mornings of cold dew.
The circus rolls through Iowa fields,
Where we reap our political yields.
Candidates present in caucus lore,
Asking, "Can I have...a little more?"
Then onward, through the primary tide,
With party's fate hitched to horse's ride.
To determine what the future finds,
Lie the strength of American minds.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US elections 2024: a calendar of the key events default The 2024 election season has officially begun in a year that will see US voters choose the next president and determine which party holds the House and Senate. Voting kicks off in Iowa on 15 January, when voters across the state gather in the unique caucus format to select their Republican candidate of choice. After Iowa, it’s full speed ahead through the primary season, with". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
